{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3657572,"name":"Dylan","username":"Dln","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/ac8455/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-06-19T01:47:33.660Z","cooked":"

Hi CD, our team is trying to get CTRE swerve for next year’s competition, could anyone who is running CTRE swerve give me a list of all the parts we need for that as well as how much of each?

Also I apologize if any questions I have should be fairly obvious, I have very little knowledge of what exactly the best way to do swerve is

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2025-06-19T18:54:36.574Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":14,"reads":417,"readers_count":416,"score":153.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":503358,"topic_slug":"full-list-of-parts-for-ctre-swerve","display_username":"Dylan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":70178,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/full-list-of-parts-for-ctre-swerve/503358/1","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3657661,"name":"","username":"nstrike","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nstrike/{size}/167038_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-19T02:34:09.056Z","cooked":"

4x cancoders
1x pigeon2
8x kraken x60 (maybe some kraken x44 if your module requires it) OR TalonFXS+NEO (maybe NEO550’s if your module requires it)
(Optional) 1 canivore

You cannot stray from this list AT ALL if you want to use CTRE Swerve code generator.

Power in a compact package. – CTR Electronics","clicks":1}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51887,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"YAGSL Creator & Maintainer"},"post_url":"/t/full-list-of-parts-for-ctre-swerve/503358/2","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3657744,"name":"Dylan","username":"Dln","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/ac8455/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-06-19T03:58:57.776Z","cooked":"

Are PowerPole adapter boards recommended to run, or is it fine without?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2025-06-19T03:58:57.776Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":377,"readers_count":376,"score":90.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":503358,"topic_slug":"full-list-of-parts-for-ctre-swerve","display_username":"Dylan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":51887,"username":"nstrike","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nstrike/{size}/167038_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":70178,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/full-list-of-parts-for-ctre-swerve/503358/3","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3657810,"name":"","username":"nstrike","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nstrike/{size}/167038_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-19T05:23:48.061Z","cooked":"

The connector boards can make your life easier or hell. Really depends on how you use them.

Andersons are only as good as the crimps you give them, so test them thoroughly!!

My team used andersons to connect to the motor and ran the cable directly to the PDP with no middlemen. Everytime i show students how to crimp andersons i warn them “I am going to make this look easy, its not going to be for you AND THATS OK!” along with pulling up the strip lengths and showing them how to crimp effectively.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2025-06-19T05:23:48.061Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":352,"readers_count":351,"score":115.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":503358,"topic_slug":"full-list-of-parts-for-ctre-swerve","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":70178,"username":"Dln","name":"Dylan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/ac8455/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51887,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"YAGSL Creator & Maintainer"},"post_url":"/t/full-list-of-parts-for-ctre-swerve/503358/4","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3657992,"name":"","username":"LPryor","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/lpryor/{size}/220287_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-19T15:35:51.098Z","cooked":"

We found the connection boards to be more trouble than they are worth. They are nice because it’s super easy to power the cancoders right off the motor. But if you don’t get those molex connectors just right you’ll have problems. (Not a ton but we’d occasionally lose our drive system CAN) We never had any problem with the Anderson connectors.

In the off season we pulled all the connection boards and just ran wires directly to the screw terminals on the krakens. It does slow down a module exchange but it increases the overall reliability.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2025-06-19T15:37:58.269Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":293,"readers_count":292,"score":93.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":503358,"topic_slug":"full-list-of-parts-for-ctre-swerve","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":70178,"username":"Dln","name":"Dylan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/ac8455/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55309,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor 8280, President Motor City Alliance"},"post_url":"/t/full-list-of-parts-for-ctre-swerve/503358/5","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3658009,"name":"Rod","username":"Weldingrod1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/weldingrod1/{size}/162109_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-19T16:03:31.782Z","cooked":"

I desperately wanted to love the anderson+CAN+power adapter boards because of the +power thing. However, this ended up being the only 4 sets of Andersons on the whole robot. I really like the ring terminal direct run thing for the Krakens. My kids damaged one of the locking molex connectors. AND, the locking molex/dupont connectors are -really- fiddly, even with the super-cool Molex professional tool in hand. SUPER picky about strip length.

Another scary item: the adapter boards use the same Torx hole on BOTH sizes of screw. If you use the wrong torque tool on the little guys you will booger them in a heartbeat! This was a BAD design decision… The Kraken’s screws are the RIGHT decision: Torx coded by screw size!

Next year I’m not buying the adapter boards. We will just run low power to each corner.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2025-06-19T16:03:31.782Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":266,"readers_count":265,"score":63.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":503358,"topic_slug":"full-list-of-parts-for-ctre-swerve","display_username":"Rod","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":46443,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/full-list-of-parts-for-ctre-swerve/503358/6","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3658098,"name":"Dylan","username":"Dln","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/ac8455/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-06-19T18:43:17.481Z","cooked":"

Would you say the convenience of the Kraken X60 PowerPole adapters are worth the cost for ease of connection?

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2025-06-19T18:43:17.481Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":210,"readers_count":209,"score":57.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":503358,"topic_slug":"full-list-of-parts-for-ctre-swerve","display_username":"Dylan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":55309,"username":"LPryor","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/lpryor/{size}/220287_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":70178,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/full-list-of-parts-for-ctre-swerve/503358/7","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3658133,"name":"Chris Bale","username":"cbale2000","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cbale2000/{size}/2142_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-19T19:02:12.977Z","cooked":"

As someone who swears by Anderson PowerPoles for just about everything, we just use the screw terminals on our Krakens. They ensure a quality connection (if you’re using the recommended torque wrenches) and we’ve never had any issues with them. You can always add regular andersons to the cables themselves if you need them.

IMO the real benefit to using the Anderson adapters is the included power and CAN connections for sensors (IE, for the CANCoders on a swerve) if your setup allows for that.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2025-06-19T19:02:12.977Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":202,"readers_count":201,"score":60.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":503358,"topic_slug":"full-list-of-parts-for-ctre-swerve","display_username":"Chris Bale","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":70178,"username":"Dln","name":"Dylan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/ac8455/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6560,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/full-list-of-parts-for-ctre-swerve/503358/8","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3658226,"name":"Dylan","username":"Dln","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/ac8455/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-06-19T19:36:04.503Z","cooked":"

Are there that many downsides to not using the Kraken PowerPole Adapters such as arcing or unexpected brownouts due to a screw from the screw terminals not being tightened properly or them coming loose during a match?

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2025-06-19T19:36:04.503Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":185,"readers_count":184,"score":52.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":503358,"topic_slug":"full-list-of-parts-for-ctre-swerve","display_username":"Dylan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":6560,"username":"cbale2000","name":"Chris Bale","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cbale2000/{size}/2142_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":70178,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/full-list-of-parts-for-ctre-swerve/503358/9","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3658232,"name":"Chris Bale","username":"cbale2000","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cbale2000/{size}/2142_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-19T19:41:05.101Z","cooked":"

We’ve never observed any arcing or screws backing out during a match (again though, I cannot stress enough the importance of using the torque wrenches). As part of our pit checklist, we do go through and check the screws periodically (like when we have a long break between matches) as a precaution, but again we’ve never had any issues during a match that was caused by loose screws.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2025-06-19T19:41:05.101Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":183,"readers_count":182,"score":51.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":503358,"topic_slug":"full-list-of-parts-for-ctre-swerve","display_username":"Chris Bale","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":70178,"username":"Dln","name":"Dylan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/ac8455/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6560,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/full-list-of-parts-for-ctre-swerve/503358/10","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3658294,"name":"","username":"LPryor","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/lpryor/{size}/220287_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-19T20:08:10.742Z","cooked":"

No I don’t recommend it.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2025-06-19T20:08:10.742Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":174,"readers_count":173,"score":34.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":503358,"topic_slug":"full-list-of-parts-for-ctre-swerve","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":70178,"username":"Dln","name":"Dylan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/ac8455/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55309,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor 8280, President Motor City Alliance"},"post_url":"/t/full-list-of-parts-for-ctre-swerve/503358/11","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3658304,"name":"Jimmy McCosker","username":"Jimmyy","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jimmyy/{size}/199505_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-19T20:20:57.637Z","cooked":"
Dln:

the screw terminals not being tightened properly or them coming loose during a match

CTRE actually sells pre-set torque wrenches to prevent this from happening and they are so nice

CTR Electronics

Pre-Set Torque Wrench – Precision Tool for Kraken X60

Ensure consistent and accurate terminal connections with this Pre-Set Torque Wrench, designed for Kraken X60 power and CAN leads. Ideal for FRC teams, robotics builds, and electronics assembly, it features audible feedback and prevents...

Price: USD 29.99

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2025-06-19T20:20:57.637Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":173,"readers_count":172,"score":79.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":503358,"topic_slug":"full-list-of-parts-for-ctre-swerve","display_username":"Jimmy McCosker","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://store.ctr-electronics.com/products/pre-set-torque-wrench","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Pre-Set Torque Wrench – Precision Tool for Kraken X60 – CTR Electronics","clicks":8}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52943,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"9496AM | Programming, Electrical, Strategy"},"post_url":"/t/full-list-of-parts-for-ctre-swerve/503358/12","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3658305,"name":"2582","username":"chadr03","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/chadr03/{size}/195529_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-19T20:20:59.147Z","cooked":"

We had one motor have both screws come loose by our third event on one of our swerve modules. Since it only happened to one motor. I am more inclined to believe it was a quality control issue that someone used the wrong torque wrench or never torqued the screws properly. After this happened, we checked all the other screws on the motors on our bot, and they were all still properly torqued.

So, my current feeling is that even though we had an issue if everything is torqued properly with the proper tools the ring terminals are a pretty solid connection. As with everything else in the electrical system, attention to detail and quality control are critical.

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2025-06-19T20:24:40.080Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":160,"readers_count":159,"score":37.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":503358,"topic_slug":"full-list-of-parts-for-ctre-swerve","display_username":"2582","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":70178,"username":"Dln","name":"Dylan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/ac8455/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13827,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/full-list-of-parts-for-ctre-swerve/503358/13","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3658655,"name":"Chris Bale","username":"cbale2000","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cbale2000/{size}/2142_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-20T14:35:49.358Z","cooked":"
chadr03:

We had one motor have both screws come loose by our third event on one of our swerve modules. Since it only happened to one motor. I am more inclined to believe it was a quality control issue that someone used the wrong torque wrench or never torqued the screws properly.

One thing we were advised to do by someone at CTRE when we got our wrenches is to actually glue the torx drivers into their corresponding torque wrenches so they can’t be mixed up accidentally, and that’s worked well for us. We did end up also buying an extra set of drivers and some manual torx wrenches so we could remove screws more easily though (the CTRE wrenches, while nice for tightening the screws, are not the most ergonomic for repeated unscrewing/screwing).

cbale2000:

One thing we were advised to do by someone at CTRE when we got our wrenches is to actually glue the torx drivers into their corresponding torque wrenches so they can’t be mixed up accidentally

I used some adhesive-lined heat shrink over both the shaft and the insert because I had the same concern.
